<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Amounts receivable from and payable to affiliates are unsecured, and are intended to be settled in the ordinary course of business. Amounts receivable from affiliates primarily consist of fees for terminaling services agreements and payments made on behalf of affiliates. Amounts payable to affiliates primarily consist of amounts due for services provided to us including those described herein and current installments of related party loans and accrued interest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(c) Long-term Debt Affiliates
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership had long-term debt with VTTI originating from historical capital investments in the terminals. The long-term debt is interest bearing based on an interest structure similar to VTTI&#8217;s interest structure with their third party banks. This affiliate debt was settled in conjunction with our formation transactions in 2014 including converting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$200 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of debt into equity. See Note 10 -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Long-term Debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(d) ATB Phase 2 Construction and Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Prior to our IPO in August 2014, our subsidiary, ATT Tanjung Bin Sdn Bhd, or ATB, began construction of the second phase of our Johore terminal (&#8220;ATB Phase 2&#8221;).&#160;In conjunction with the IPO and pursuant to the Omnibus Agreement, we agreed to transfer all assets related to the development, construction or operation of ATB Phase 2 to VTTI as promptly as reasonably practicable after the closing of our IPO. After good faith efforts to transfer these assets, we found it reasonably impracticable to do so, and ATB will continue to own the assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In July 2014, VTTI granted to ATB a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$95 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;loan facility. ATB periodically draws on this facility to pay for costs and expenses related to ATB Phase 2. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$56.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;respectively is outstanding and incurs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	interest at a rate of LIBOR plus a margin of 3.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. ATB may utilize the facility upon three business days&#8217; notice to VTTI. VTTI additionally agreed to indemnify ATB from all claims and losses incurred by ATB in connection with ATB Phase 2. In consideration for VTTI&#8217;s obligations under the ATB Phase 2 Facility, ATB agreed to remit to VTTI all revenue received from ATB Phase 2 in excess of the costs ATB incurs to operate ATB Phase 2. Such excess revenue will initially repay the outstanding amounts drawn on the ATB Phase 2 Facility and, upon repayment of the amounts outstanding under the facility in full, will be remitted to VTTI without restriction. ATB&#8217;s repayment obligations will commence when ATB Phase 2 is completed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In conjunction with our formation transactions, we recognized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of construction work in progress and a corresponding liability for the amount due under the ATB Phase 2 Loan. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$24.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;liability was then settled as part of
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F- 20
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage122"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	our formation transactions. During the period ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$20.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$56.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was drawn down under the related facility. See Note 10 -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Long-term Debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for additional information on the ATB Phase 2 Loan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:30PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In August 2015, ATB Phase 2 initiated operations and as such began recording revenue and related expenses for the operations of the Phase 2 assets. As the Phase 2 assets are part of ATB, the associated revenues and expenses for ATB Phase 2 are included in the Partnership's consolidated statement of operations and consolidated balance sheet. In accordance with the agreement described further above, revenue received in excess of the costs to operate ATB Phase 2 are to repay outstanding amounts drawn under the facility including interest and any excess cash at ATB related to the ATB Phase 2 assets is for the economic benefit of VTTI BV and as such is classified as restricted cash on the Partnership's consolidated balance sheet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(e) Indemnifications and guarantees
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Tax indemnifications
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In conjunction with our IPO and formation transactions and pursuant to the Omnibus Agreement, VTTI has indemnified us of all tax liabilities attributable to the operation of the assets contributed to us prior to the time they were contributed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Environmental indemnifications
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In conjunction with our IPO and formation transactions and pursuant to the Omnibus Agreement, VTTI has indemnified us for all known liabilities exceeding
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$29.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in the aggregate and certain unknown liabilities arising out of any violation of environmental laws and any environmental condition or event associated with the operation of our assets and occurring at or before the closing of our IPO whether discovered before or after the closing of our IPO. Indemnification for all known environmental losses is limited to those identified within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the applicable completion dates of soil remediation projects at our Amsterdam and Antwerp terminals. Indemnification for all unknown environmental liabilities is limited to those identified prior to the fifth anniversary of the closing of our IPO. Liabilities resulting from a change in law after the closing of our IPO are excluded from the environmental indemnity. There is an aggregate cap of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$10 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on the amount of indemnity coverage provided by VTTI for environmental and toxic tort liabilities. No such claim may be made unless the aggregate dollar amount of all claims exceeds
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in which case VTTI is liable for claims only to the extent such aggregate amount exceeds
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Guarantees and New or Extended Contracts
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Pursuant to the Omnibus Agreement, VTTI guaranteed the rates of certain capacity contracted by Vitol for a specified period of time after the applicable Vitol terminaling services agreement expires. If VTTI fails to reimburse the Partnership for the aggregate monthly amount that Vitol would have paid under the expiring terminaling services agreements, Vitol and MISC, jointly and severally, must reimburse the Partnership for such losses. In connection with the acquisition of MISC's
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;share of VTTI, Vitol agreed to extend or enter into new terminaling services agreements with terms expiring on or after the end of each agreement's respective guarantee period expiration date and at rates and capacity, in the aggregate, equal to or greater than the rates and capacity currently set forth in the existing Vitol terminaling services agreements. On November 9, 2015, following a determination by the Board that the guarantees by VTTI, Vitol and MISC are no longer necessary upon the effectiveness of the new Vitol terminaling services agreements, the parties to the Omnibus Agreement have amended the Omnibus Agreement to remove all provisions related to such guarantees.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The table below specifies the changes from the Omnibus Guarantee on Vitol&#8217;s existing storage capacity and the revised expiration of the contracted capacity for each respective terminal:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

	2.8

</DIV>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Fujairah
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

	UAE

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F- 21
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage123"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(f) Administrative Services and Secondment Agreement
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In conjunction with our IPO in August 2014, we entered into an administrative services agreement (the &#8220;Administrative Services Agreement&#8221;) with VTTI Holdings, a wholly owned subsidiary, pursuant to which VTTI Holdings will provide certain management and administrative services to us. Pursuant to the applicable provisions of a secondment agreement (the &#8220;Secondment Agreement&#8221;) that VTTI Holdings entered into with VTTI Services, an indirect subsidiary of VTTI, VTTI Services makes its employees available to VTTI Holdings, including the executive officers of our general partner, to provide these services. The services provided under the Administrative Services Agreement are provided in a diligent manner, as we may reasonably direct. VTTI Holdings reimburses VTTI Services for the costs that it incurs in providing administration and office expenses as well as compensation and benefits to its employees made available to VTTI Holdings with a cost mark-up of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;applied to the salaries of back-office staff,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;applied to the salaries of executive officers and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	12.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;applied to executive officer bonuses. Total amounts incurred under the secondment agreement and reimbursement of expenses to VTTI Services for the period ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(g) MLP Loan Agreement
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In July 2014, VTTI granted to the Partnership a related party loan facility of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The loan drawn on this facility may be used for general corporate and working capital purposes including financing of dropdown acquisitions from VTTI. The loan facility incurs interest on the aggregate outstanding balance of the loan at LIBOR plus a margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum. The final maturity date of the loan facility is December 31, 2020. On July 1, 2015, the Partnership borrowed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;under this loan facility. The proceeds of this loan were used for the purchase of an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;economic interest in VTTI Operating from VTTI as discussed further below. See Note 10 -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Long-term Debt
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for additional information.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(h) Acquisition of Additional Interests in VTTI Operating
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;PADDING-LEFT:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On July 1, 2015, the Partnership completed the acquisition of an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;economic interest in VTTI Operating for total consideration of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from VTTI. As a result of this acquisition, the Partnership&#8217;s total economic interest in VTTI Operating increased to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	42.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As discussed above, the Partnership used the proceeds from its existing related party loan facility for the purchase consideration. See Note 21 -
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Non Controlling Interests
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for additional information.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VTTI2015123120-F_HTM_SDFE7A89DA03702E7D3AE1B5156E0EE16">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:12PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 5 - Segment Information
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership does not present segment information as it considers its operations to occur in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;reportable segment: the energy storage terminaling business. We derive our revenues and profits from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;operating segments being the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;geographical locations the terminals operate in. The operating segments have been aggregated into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;reportable segment because they have similar long-term economic characteristics, services, operations, types and classes of customers and methods used to render their services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VTTI2015123120-F_HTM_S52C52A639F8B2D1FCEF51B5154176A2A">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:12PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 6 - Current Assets and Prepaid Expenses
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(a) Trade Accounts Receivable
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Trade accounts receivable are presented net of allowance for doubtful accounts. The allowance for doubtful accounts was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(b) Prepaid Expenses
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The prepaid operational lease expenses relate to operational lease expenses paid in advance and are recognized using a straight line basis as lease costs in operating expenses over the period for which the prepayment was made. The contractual duration of the various leases range from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Prepaid expenses as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;consist of the following:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 7 - Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Property, plant and equipment, at cost as of

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	&#32;and

	$1.3 million

	, respectively, were capitalized as part of the costs of construction work in progress.
</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_39"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 8 - Intangible Assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Intangible assets consist of lease rights and relate to consideration paid to former lessees to acquire an option to a lease or to take over an existing lease contract from a third party company. Any amounts paid to the lessor are recognized as part of the lease contract upon their classification. Any amounts paid to former lessees to take over the contract are recognized as lease rights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Capitalized lease rights, at cost as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="6">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:73%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:12%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:12%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(in US$ millions)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The capitalized lease rights relate to the acquisition of such rights for an adjacent plot of land at the Rotterdam terminal amounting to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$35.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$40.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively for which we paid the former lessee an amount to take over the lease contract with the port authorities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Amortization expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;during the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. The remaining amortization period is related to the maturity date of the lease and amounts between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	37
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	39
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;years, as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Estimated amortization expense for amortizable intangible assets for the next five years amounts to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for each period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2020
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VTTI2015123120-F_HTM_SE4DFF936A73678F521251B5154D8B679">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:12PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:12PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 9 - Goodwill
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Goodwill arose in 2006 when
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the shares of Eurotank Amsterdam B.V. were acquired in a transaction that was accounted for as a business combination. In 2007 goodwill increased with the purchase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	90%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the shares in VTTI Fujairah Terminals Ltd.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The carrying amount of goodwill was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$110.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$119.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The difference in the carrying amount of goodwill arises from the foreign currency translation from Euro to U.S. dollar for the goodwill amount associated with Eurotank Amsterdam B.V.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Goodwill as of
</FONT>

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is as follows:

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_41"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:12PX;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 10 -&#160;Long-term Debt
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Long-term debt as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;comprises the following:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;MARGIN-LEFT:AUTO;MARGIN-RIGHT:AUTO;WIDTH:681PX;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="18">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:296PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:55PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:4PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:5PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:55PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:4PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:5PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:55PX;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:4PX;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Affiliate Loan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership had long-term debt with VTTI originating from historical capital investments in our terminals. The long-term debt was interest bearing based on an interest structure similar to VTTI&#8217;s interest structure with their third party banks. In conjunction with our IPO and formation transactions we repaid a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$660.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of affiliate loans and an additional loan of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$200.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;borrowed during 2014 was converted to equity. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;amounts outstanding as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Project Finance Loan - ATB Phase I
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On March&#160;25, 2011, our subsidiary, ATT Tanjung Bin Sdn Bhd, or ATB, as borrower, entered into a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	seven
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$230 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;loan agreement with a syndicate of lenders, in connection with the construction of phase one of our Johore terminal. This facility was repaid in conjunction with the formation transactions and refinancing in connection with our IPO in August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and therefore
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;amounts were outstanding as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	VTTI Operating Revolving Credit Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:32PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Prior to our IPO, VTTI Operating entered into a new
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8364;500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;revolving credit facility with a termination date of July&#160;31, 2018 (the &#8220;VTTI Operating Revolving Credit Facility&#8221;). During the first quarter of 2015, we increased the amount available under the facility by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8364;80 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in accordance with the terms of the facility to a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8364;580 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and increased the percentage available for borrowings in US dollars to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	60%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$104.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$573.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;respectively was drawn down on the VTTI Operating Revolving Credit Facility. Borrowings under the facility in Euros incur interest at three month Euribor plus a margin (as defined in the facility) and borrowings in US dollars incur interest at three month Libor plus a margin (as defined in the facility). The proceeds from the facility were used to repay existing indebtedness. The unused portion of the facility is subject to an annual commitment fee of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	35%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the interest margin.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;TEXT-INDENT:32PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In December 2015, we repaid a portion of this facility in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$435.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;which consisted of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8364;180 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$245 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, with the proceeds from the issuance of the Senior Unsecured Notes (discussed further below). After the repayment, the total amount of the facility was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8364;359 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The VTTI Operating Revolving Credit Facility contains covenants and conditions that, among other things, limit VTTI Operating&#8217;s ability to make cash distributions, incur indebtedness, create certain liens or security over its assets, make investments and enter into a merger or sale of substantially all of its assets and customary events of default under the VTTI Operating Revolving Credit Facility for a facility of this type. Financial covenants
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F- 25
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage127"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	include a debt cover ratio maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and an interest coverage ratio minimum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;we were in compliance with our covenants under this facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Senior Unsecured Notes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On December 15, 2015, our subsidiary, VTTI Operating, issued the following Senior Unsecured Notes, collectively, the Senior Unsecured Notes:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</TD>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

</FONT>

	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.53%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Series A Senior Unsecured Notes due December 15, 2022;
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">

	&#8226;
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$72 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.87%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Series B Senior Unsecured Notes due December 15, 2025;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

	$98 million

	&#32;Series D Senior Unsecured Notes due December 15, 2022; and

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8364;130 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.86%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The principal amounts of the Senior Unsecured Notes are due in full at maturity and interest is due semiannually on June 15th and December 15th. The Senior Unsecured Notes contain covenants and conditions that, among other things, limit VTTI Operating&#8217;s ability to make cash distributions, incur indebtedness, create certain liens or security over its assets, make investments and enter into a merger or sale of substantially all of its assets and customary events of default. Financial covenants include a debt cover ratio maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and an interest coverage ratio minimum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;we were in compliance with our covenants for these Senior Unsecured Notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	ATB Phase 2 Related Party Facility
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;July&#160;8, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our subsidiary ATB, as borrower, entered into a related party facility agreement (&#8220;the ATB Phase 2 Facility&#8221;) with VTTI which provides a maximum borrowing under the facility of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$95.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in connection with the construction of phase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our Johore terminal. The facility limit is up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$95 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;with a termination date of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	July 8, 2024
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The facility incurs interest at LIBOR plus a margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The total amount outstanding as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$56.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Related Party MLP Loan Agreement
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In July 2014, VTTI granted to the Partnership a loan facility of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The loan drawn on this facility may be used for general corporate and working capital purposes including financing of dropdown acquisitions from VTTI. The loan facility incurs interest on the aggregate outstanding balance of the loan at LIBOR plus a margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per annum with a final maturity date of December 31, 2020. On July 1, 2015, we borrowed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$75 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;under this loan facility. The proceeds of this loan were used for the purchase of an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in VTTI Operating.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VTTI2015123120-F_HTM_SCE8F6D086D7D96FD6BAE1B5153F6EC14">
</A>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(a) Postretirement Benefit Obligation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;defined benefit pension plans (Netherlands and Belgium) covering a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	158
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;employees (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	164
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	). The cost of providing the defined benefit pension is determined based upon independent actuarial valuations and several actuarial market assumptions. Under accounting standards for postretirement benefits (ASC Topic 715), the Partnership recognizes the overfunded or underfunded status of each of its defined benefit pension as an asset or liability on the consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F- 26

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

	Amounts recognized in accumulated other comprehensive income consist of net actuarial gains (losses) of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.6 million

	December&#160;31, 2015

	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$(0.1) million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014

	. The accumulated benefit obligation for the pension plan was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$13.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	$17.0 million

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The expected long-term rate of return is based on the portfolio as a whole and not on the sum of the returns on individual asset categories. The return is based exclusively on historical returns, without adjustments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership&#8217;s investment strategy for its pension plan assets not invested in guaranteed investment contracts is to maintain a diversified portfolio of asset classes with the primary goal of meeting long-term cash requirements as they become due.&#160;Assets are primarily invested in diversified funds that hold equity or debt securities to maintain the security of the funds while maximizing the returns within the investment policy.&#160;The investment policy specifies the type of investment vehicles appropriate for the plan, asset allocation guidelines, criteria for selection of investment managers, procedures to monitor overall investment performance, as well as investment manager performance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The plan assets of the Belgium defined benefit plan are arranged in a Guaranteed Investment Contract (&#8220;GIC&#8221;) with an insurance company. The contract is an investment in which the fund manager holds or invests in single group annuity contracts issued directly to the retirement plan. The plan receives a direct guarantee of principal and accrued interest from the insurance company. The contract guarantees a fixed rate of return of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3.25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;regardless of the performance of the underlying assets, which the insurance company holds within their account.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:90.625%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="6">
</TD>
</TR>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:77%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:10%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:10%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_46"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Target asset allocation
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership&#8217;s retirement plan assets are reported at fair value. Level 1 assets include investments in publicly traded equity securities, bonds and cash and cash equivalents. These securities (or the underlying investments of the funds) are actively traded and valued using quoted prices for identical securities from the market exchanges.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A GIC is a stable value fund, which is classified as Level 3. The plan assets are valued at fair value by discounting the related future payments based on current yields of similar instruments with comparable duration considering the creditworthiness of the issuer. The movement in Level 3 assets for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8212;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	7.5
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

</TR>
</TABLE>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Expected contributions to the benefit plan during the upcoming year amount to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, comprising of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of Partnership contributions and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of participant contributions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The benefits expected to be paid from the pension plan in each of the five years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2020
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;respectively. The aggregate benefits expected to be paid in each of the five years from 2020 through 2024 are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The expected benefits are based on the same assumptions used to measure the Partnership&#8217;s benefit obligation at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and include estimated future employee service.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(b) Post-employment Obligation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Related to the Partnership&#8217;s operations in the United Arab Emirates, employees within those legal entities are entitled to a payment upon termination of their employment contracts.&#160;This payment is based on the number of years of service provided to their employer and is calculated based on the salary earned at the moment of termination.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The related liability has been determined by actuarial calculations using employee specific data such as the average length of service of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6.12 years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5.91
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) average salary increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	), and a discount rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	).&#160;The total liability amounts to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(c) Defined Contribution Plan Expenses
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership contributed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as a cost for the defined contribution plans in the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 12 -&#160;Environmental Provisions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The environmental provisions result from the acquisition of Eurotank Amsterdam B.V. in 2006 and ATPC Terminal N.V. in 2010. Both companies have recognized provisions for soil contamination of the entire premises. The environmental provisions as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;were as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The changes in the total provision relate to the effects of foreign exchange and utilization of the provision.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VTTI2015123120-F_HTM_S528F79EEE6932164E6B11B5153BC946F">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Note 13 -&#160;Income Taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(a) Components of Current and Deferred Tax Expense
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The components of current and deferred income tax expense attributable to income for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(b) Components of Income Tax Expense
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	VTTI Energy Partners LP is a Marshall Islands limited partnership which is managed and controlled in the United Kingdom (UK). We are not subject to tax in the Marshall Islands and we are considered transparent for UK taxation purposes and not subject to tax in our own name in the UK, except for our UK subsidiary holding company. A reconciliation between the income tax expense resulting from applying the Marshall Islands or United Kingdom statutory income tax rate and our reported income tax expense has not been presented as it would not provide useful information to the users of our financial statements. However, our subsidiaries operate and earn income in various countries and are subject to taxation laws in those countries. Changes in levels of income, changes in tax laws, and the locations and jurisdictions of our terminals, can affect the Partnership&#8217;s overall effective taxable expense. Income tax expense by jurisdiction before adjustment for permanent differences and other items is as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(c) Components of Deferred Tax Assets and Liabilities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Deferred income taxes reflect the net tax effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used for income tax purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The tax effects of temporary differences that give rise to significant portions of the deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are presented below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F- 30
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Net operating loss carryforwards totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$190 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;are available to reduce future taxable earnings. These net operating loss carryforwards include
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$102 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;with no expiration date; the remaining carryforwards have expiration dates between
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2036
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A valuation allowance for deferred tax assets is recorded when it is more likely than not that some or all of the benefit from the deferred tax asset will not be realized. The valuation allowances amounted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. During the year ended December 31, 2014 we reversed a valuation allowance in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;related to the deferred tax asset for tax loss carry forwards from transferred pre-fiscal unity losses in the Netherlands.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The net deferred tax asset and liability as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is classified in the consolidated and combined carve-out balance sheets as non-current.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;unrecognized tax benefits as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. During the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, the Partnership did not incur any interest or penalties on its tax returns. The Partnership is not currently under examination by any U.S. federal, state, or non-U.S. tax authorities. The following table summarizes the earliest tax years that remain subject to examination by major taxable jurisdictions in which the Partnership operates:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(d) Netherlands Fiscal Unity
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Within a fiscal unity the participating entities are jointly and severally liable for corporate income tax liabilities originating from the period in which the fiscal unity existed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F- 31
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage133"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Up until August 2008 the Netherlands terminals of the Partnership formed part of a fiscal unity for the corporate income tax of which Vitol Holdings B.V. was the fiscal parent company. As a result of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50.00%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;acquisition by MISC in terms of the Share Purchase Agreement in August 2010, this fiscal unity was unwound and a new fiscal unity was formed to incorporate the Netherlands terminals of the Partnership, of which VTTI was the parent company. As of August&#160;1, 2014 this fiscal unity ceased to exist and a new fiscal unity was formed consisting of all Netherlands entities within the Partnership with VTTI Operating as the parent.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:24PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(e) Tax Filings in Other Jurisdictions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Partnership files consolidated and standalone income tax returns in various foreign jurisdictions. In the normal course of business, our income tax filings are subject to review by various taxing authorities. In connection with such reviews, disputes could arise with the tax authorities over the interpretation or application of certain income tax rules related to our business in that tax jurisdiction. Such disputes may result in future tax and interest and penalty assessments by these tax authorities. The ultimate resolution of tax contingencies will take place upon the earlier of (i)&#160;the settlement date with the applicable tax authorities in either cash or agreement of income tax positions or (ii)&#160;the date when the tax authorities are statutorily prohibited from adjusting the Partnership&#8217;s tax computations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="VTTI2015123120-F_HTM_S163189231A01154B12681B5155A4D059">
</A>
</DIV>

	Note 14 - Fair Value Measurements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:8PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Trade receivables, other current assets, accounts payable, accrued expenses, and other current liabilities are carried at cost which approximates fair value due to their short-term nature.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:16PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	56.1
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	56.1
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
